name: H6-1 - Bulk Flammable Gases
intro: This questionnaire verifies knowledge of operational procedures and safety measures for incidents involving bulk flammable gases as defined in Operational Instruction NCI 32.

structure.description: Describe the operational considerations for bulk flammable gases.
options: Approach from upwind where possible
Stabilise and evacuate the inner cordon and other operational areas as required
Consider the use of chemical splash suits
Eliminate all sources of ignition in the inner cordon
Maintain a safe distance of 800m at all times
Identify the gas and its properties and monitor levels of flammability
Use dry powder to dilute the gas in the atmosphere
Notify air traffic control authorities to keep air space clear in vicinity of large leaks
Media statements
correctAnswer: Stabilise and evacuate the inner cordon and other operational areas as required
Consider the use of chemical splash suits
Eliminate all sources of ignition in the inner cordon
Identify the gas and its properties and monitor levels of flammability
Notify air traffic control authorities to keep air space clear in vicinity of large leaks

structure.description: What is the water application rate to cool gas tanks or pipe-work that have been subjected to direct flame?
options: 2 x GForce branches set at 470L/min
1920 L/m (32 L/s) per m2 in the area of flame impingement.
A ground monitor supplying 800 L/min
360 L/min (6 L/s) per m2 in the area of flame impingement.
structure.correctAnswer: 1920 L/m (32 L/s) per m2 in the area of flame impingement.

structure.description: Describe the control measures used when dealing with the hazards of BLEVE and explosions when controlling fires in bulk flammable gas installations.
options: All personnel will be trained in the conditions to be encountered and the safe practices required when working at incidents involving bulk flammable gases
Lay down a foam blanket surrounding the bulk flammable gas
Pre-planning and risk assessment
FENZ personnel will be briefed on the plan of action and safety measures
Use only the minimum numbers of FENZ personnel needed to conduct operations
Chemical splash suits to be worn if exposure to flammable gas is likely
Establish an inner cordon with a radius of 500m from the fire
Cool tanks and pipe-work, taking care not to freeze up relief valves.
Evacuate all unnecessary personnel, other service personnel and members of the public from inner cordon
Wear structural firefighting uniform and BA
correctAnswer: All personnel will be trained in the conditions to be encountered and the safe practices required when working at incidents involving bulk flammable gases
FENZ personnel will be briefed on the plan of action and safety measures
Use only the minimum numbers of FENZ personnel needed to conduct operations
Establish an inner cordon with a radius of 500m from the fire
Cool tanks and pipe-work, taking care not to freeze up relief valves.
Evacuate all unnecessary personnel, other service personnel and members of the public from inner cordon
Wear structural firefighting uniform and BA

structure.description: In addition to the above what other control measures should be employed when dealing with the significant hazards of Ignition of gas clouds and cold burns encountered when controlling leaks in bulk flammable gases.
options: Use water protection technique to disperse the gas cloud
Personnel will not enter gas cloud
Consider Gas Tight Suits for operational personnel
Establish inner cordon (consider wind direction)
Awareness of dangers of liquid leaks
correctAnswer: Personnel will not enter gas cloud
Awareness of dangers of liquid leaks
